definitions.definition: To manage to touch (a target) in the right place.

definitions.example: Somebody's been here! Hit the lights!
We hit the grocery store on the way to the park.

definitions.definition: To encounter an obstacle or other difficulty.
definitions.example: You'll hit some nasty thunderstorms if you descend too late.  We hit a lot of traffic coming back from the movies.
The economy was hit by a recession.  The hurricane hit his fishing business hard.
The external web servers hit DBSRV7, but the internal web server hits DBSRV3.

definitions.definition: To inhale an amount of smoke from a narcotic substance, particularly marijuana.
A series of hits or blows directed at a person or object.

definitions.example: The batter's hitting improved with practice.
